storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to suggest alternative time slots when conflicts occur to facilitate quick rescheduling

testCases.title: Validate generation of alternative time slot suggestions
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface is accessible
At least one resource with existing bookings is available in the system
System clock is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and attempt to create a new schedule that conflicts with an existing booking
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict notification

steps.action: Observe the time taken for the system to generate alternative time slot suggestions
steps.expectedResult: Alternative time slot suggestions are generated and displayed within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Review the displayed alternative suggestions in the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Suggestions are displayed clearly with time slots, resource names, and availability status. All suggested slots show no conflicts

steps.action: Select one of the suggested alternative time slots from the list
steps.expectedResult: Selected alternative is highlighted and ready for confirmation

steps.action: Click the save or apply button to confirm the schedule with the selected alternative
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is updated with the selected alternative time slot, conflict alert is removed, and success confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Schedule is saved with the alternative time slot
No conflict alerts are present
Resource is booked for the new time slot
System logs the schedule change

testCases.title: Ensure suggestions do not conflict with existing schedules
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple resources have existing bookings at various time slots
Scheduling database contains current and accurate booking data
System has access to resource availability calendars

steps.action: Create a schedule that conflicts with an existing booking to trigger alternative suggestions
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict and generates alternative time slot suggestions

steps.action: Review each suggested alternative time slot and cross-reference with the resource availability calendar
steps.expectedResult: All suggested time slots are verified to be free of conflicts with existing schedules

steps.action: Verify that the resources required for each suggested slot are available and not double-booked
steps.expectedResult: Resources are confirmed available for all suggested time slots with no overlapping bookings

steps.action: Select one of the suggested alternative time slots
steps.expectedResult: Selected alternative is highlighted for confirmation

steps.action: Save the schedule with the selected alternative time slot
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully without any conflict errors or warnings

steps.action: Verify the saved schedule in the resource availability calendar
steps.expectedResult: New booking appears in the calendar with no overlapping conflicts

postconditions: Schedule is saved without conflicts
Resource availability calendar reflects the new booking
No double-booking exists for any resource
System maintains data integrity

testCases.title: Test performance of suggestion generation under load
preconditions: Multiple Scheduler users are logged in simultaneously
System has sufficient test data with multiple resources and bookings
Performance monitoring tools are configured and active
System logs are enabled and accessible
Load testing environment is prepared

steps.action: Simulate 10-20 concurrent schedulers creating conflicting schedules simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: System processes all conflict detections concurrently without errors

steps.action: Measure the response time for alternative suggestion generation for each concurrent request
steps.expectedResult: Alternative suggestions are generated within 2 seconds for all concurrent requests

steps.action: Monitor system response times using performance monitoring tools during the load test
steps.expectedResult: System response times remain within SLA requirements (under 2 seconds) throughout the test

steps.action: Review system logs for any errors, exceptions, or timeout messages during the load test
steps.expectedResult: No errors, exceptions, or significant delays are observed in the system logs

steps.action: Verify that all generated suggestions across concurrent requests are accurate and conflict-free
steps.expectedResult: All suggestions maintain data integrity and do not contain conflicts despite concurrent processing

postconditions: System performance meets SLA requirements under load
No errors or data corruption occurred
System logs document all transactions
System returns to normal state after load test

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view resource availability calendars to make informed scheduling decisions and avoid conflicts

testCases.title: Validate display of resource availability calendar
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource availability data exists in the system
Multiple resources with various booking statuses are available
Scheduling interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the resource availability view from the main scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Resource availability calendar is displayed with current month view showing all resources

steps.action: Verify that the calendar displays both booked and free time slots with visual differentiation
steps.expectedResult: Booked slots are clearly marked (e.g., different color or pattern) and distinguishable from free slots

steps.action: Apply a filter to select a specific resource type from the available filter options
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to display only resources matching the selected type

steps.action: Apply a date range filter to view availability for a specific time period (e.g., next week)
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to show availability only for the selected date range

steps.action: Review the filtered calendar to verify booked and free time slots are accurately displayed
steps.expectedResult: All time slots are clearly differentiated, accurate, and match the actual booking records in the system

steps.action: Click on individual time slots to view detailed booking information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed information about bookings (if booked) or availability confirmation (if free) is displayed

postconditions: Calendar remains in filtered view until user changes filters
User can proceed to create schedules based on viewed availability
No data is modified during the viewing process

testCases.title: Ensure real-time updates of availability calendar
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource availability calendar is open and displayed
System supports real-time data synchronization
At least one resource with available time slots exists

steps.action: Note the current availability status of a specific resource and time slot in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Current availability status is clearly visible (e.g., free slot shown in available state)

steps.action: Create or modify a schedule that affects the noted resource's availability (book a previously free slot)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is created/modified successfully and saved to the system

steps.action: Observe the availability calendar without manually refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Calendar automatically updates within 2 seconds to reflect the new booking status

steps.action: Manually refresh the calendar view using the refresh button or page reload
steps.expectedResult: Latest availability data is displayed, confirming the booking change is persisted

steps.action: Verify that no stale or outdated data is shown by comparing calendar with the scheduling database records
steps.expectedResult: Calendar accurately reflects current bookings with no discrepancies or stale data

steps.action: Delete or cancel the recently created booking
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates within 2 seconds to show the time slot as available again

postconditions: Calendar displays current real-time availability
All changes are reflected accurately
System maintains data synchronization
No stale data remains in the interface

testCases.title: Verify access control for availability calendar
preconditions: Multiple user accounts exist with different roles (Scheduler and non-Scheduler roles)
Role-based access control is configured in the system
System logging is enabled for security audit
Authentication system is functioning properly

steps.action: Log in to the system using credentials for a user with Scheduler role
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the resource availability calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and the availability calendar is displayed without errors

steps.action: Log out from the Scheduler account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and returned to login page

steps.action: Log in using credentials for a user without Scheduler role (e.g., Viewer or Guest role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated with limited permissions

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the resource availability calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an appropriate error message (e.g., 'Access Denied: Insufficient Permissions')

steps.action: Verify that the user is not able to bypass access control through direct URL access
steps.expectedResult: Direct URL access is blocked and same access denied message is displayed

steps.action: Review system security logs for both access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Both successful access (Scheduler) and denied access (non-Scheduler) attempts are logged with timestamp, user ID, and action details for audit purposes

postconditions: Access control is enforced correctly
Unauthorized users cannot view availability calendar
All access attempts are logged for security audit
System security integrity is maintained

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to log all detected conflicts and resolutions to support audit and reporting

testCases.title: Validate logging of detected conflicts
preconditions: User has valid authentication credentials with scheduler role
Conflict logs database is accessible and operational
API endpoint GET /api/conflicts/logs is available
At least two resources or time slots exist that can create a conflict
System logging service is running and configured correctly

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by assigning the same resource to two overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict notification to the user

steps.action: Verify the conflict event is logged in the database with timestamp, conflict type, affected resources, and conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Conflict event is logged with correct details including timestamp in ISO format, resource IDs, time slot information, and conflict severity

steps.action: Send GET request to /api/conflicts/logs endpoint with valid authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 status code with logged conflict data in JSON format

steps.action: Verify the returned conflict log contains the recently created conflict with accurate information including timestamp, resource details, and conflict description
steps.expectedResult: Logged conflict is returned with all accurate information matching the created conflict scenario

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs API endpoint using credentials without proper authorization (non-scheduler role)
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict logs API endpoint without authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 401 Unauthorized status code and access is denied

steps.action: Verify logs are accessible only to users with scheduler or admin roles by checking role-based access control
steps.expectedResult: Access control is enforced correctly - only authorized users can view logs, unauthorized access attempts are denied and logged

postconditions: Conflict event remains logged in the database
All access attempts (authorized and unauthorized) are recorded in security audit logs
System returns to normal operational state
No data corruption or inconsistencies in conflict logs

testCases.title: Verify logging of conflict resolution actions
preconditions: User is authenticated as scheduler with conflict resolution permissions
At least one active scheduling conflict exists in the system
Conflict logs database is accessible and operational
Export functionality is configured and available
API endpoint for querying logs is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict management interface and locate an existing scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is displayed with all relevant details including affected resources, time slots, and conflict type

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button for the displayed conflict
steps.expectedResult: System displays acknowledgment confirmation and updates conflict status to 'Acknowledged'

steps.action: Select a resolution action (e.g., reassign resource, modify time slot) and apply the resolution
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is resolved successfully and system displays resolution confirmation message

steps.action: Verify the resolution action is logged in the database with user ID, timestamp, action type, and resolution details
steps.expectedResult: Resolution action is logged with complete information including scheduler username, timestamp in ISO format, action taken, and before/after state

steps.action: Send GET request to /api/conflicts/logs endpoint with filter parameters for resolution entries
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 status with filtered results showing only resolution log entries

steps.action: Verify the returned resolution log entries contain accurate data matching the actions performed
steps.expectedResult: Resolution actions are present in logs with accurate user information, timestamps, and resolution details matching the performed actions

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict logs export interface and select export format (CSV or JSON)
steps.expectedResult: Export format options are displayed and selectable

steps.action: Click 'Export' button to generate conflict logs export file
steps.expectedResult: System generates export file and initiates download with appropriate filename including timestamp

steps.action: Open the exported file and verify it contains complete conflict and resolution data
steps.expectedResult: Exported file contains all conflict detection events and resolution actions with complete data including timestamps, user information, conflict details, and resolution outcomes

postconditions: Conflict resolution is permanently logged in the database
Exported file is saved and contains accurate audit trail data
Conflict status is updated to 'Resolved' in the system
All log entries maintain data integrity and consistency

testCases.title: Ensure logging does not degrade system performance
preconditions: Performance monitoring tools are configured and operational
System baseline performance metrics are documented (SLA thresholds defined)
Test environment can simulate high volume conflict scenarios
Resource monitoring tools are available to track CPU, memory, and I/O usage
Logging service is running with standard configuration

steps.action: Record baseline system performance metrics including response time, CPU usage, memory usage, and database I/O
steps.expectedResult: Baseline metrics are captured and documented for comparison

steps.action: Execute automated script to simulate high volume of conflict detections (minimum 100 conflicts within 1 minute)
steps.expectedResult: System successfully detects and processes all simulated conflicts without crashes or errors

steps.action: Monitor system response time during high volume conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: System response time remains within SLA thresholds (under 3 seconds for log retrieval as per success metrics)

steps.action: Verify all conflict events are logged correctly during high volume scenario by querying the logs database
steps.expectedResult: 100% of simulated conflicts are logged with accurate timestamps and details, no missing log entries

steps.action: Monitor logging service resource usage including CPU utilization, memory consumption, and disk I/O during high volume operations
steps.expectedResult: Logging service resource usage remains within acceptable limits (CPU < 70%, memory < 80% of allocated resources)

steps.action: Check for system bottlenecks by analyzing performance metrics and identifying any resource contention
steps.expectedResult: No bottlenecks detected in logging operations, database connections remain available, no queue buildup in logging service

steps.action: Execute standard scheduling operations (create, update, delete schedules) during ongoing logging activity
steps.expectedResult: All scheduling operations complete successfully without errors

steps.action: Measure scheduling operation completion time and compare against baseline metrics
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling operations complete within normal time ranges with no significant delays (variance < 10% from baseline)

steps.action: Review system error logs and application logs for any errors or warnings related to logging operations
steps.expectedResult: No errors or critical warnings related to logging service, all operations completed successfully

postconditions: System performance returns to baseline levels
All simulated conflict logs are stored in database
No memory leaks or resource exhaustion detected
System remains stable and operational
Performance test results are documented for future reference
